title: 114_s3255
content: The Act is titled the "Blocking Deadly Fentanyl Imports Act" and includes an amendment to the definition of major illicit drug producing countries. The "Blocking Deadly Fentanyl Imports Act" amends the definition of major illicit drug producing countries to include those that are significant sources of illicit fentanyl, fentanyl analogues, or their precursors. The "Blocking Deadly Fentanyl Imports Act" amends the definition of major illicit drug producing countries to include those that are significant sources of illicit fentanyl, fentanyl analogues, or their precursors. SEC. 3. INTERNATIONAL NARCOTICS CONTROL STRATEGY REPORT. Section 489(a) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include a new section identifying countries that are significant exporters of illicit fentanyl and its precursors, sources of diversion for these chemicals, and their cooperation with the US in prevention efforts. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to prevent the export of illicit fentanyl and its precursors from certain countries to the United States. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to prevent the export of illicit fentanyl and its precursors from certain countries to the United States. SEC. 4. WITHHOLDING OF BILATERAL AND MULTILATERAL ASSISTANCE. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to update the designation of countries without emergency scheduling procedures. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to designate countries failing to adopt emergency scheduling procedures for new illicit drugs and synthetics comparable to the Controlled Substances Act. The Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003 is amended to designate countries incapable of prosecuting criminals for controlled substance analogues and those not requiring registration of pill presses and tableting machines. The Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003, as amended, designates countries not requiring registration of tableting machines and encapsulating machines for controlled substances.
